intro: Aporosa lucida var. lucida, commonly known as the shining aporosa, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
